pullRequest.body:
The new attribute generates theorems like

```lean
List.chain_eq : @List.Chain = fun {α} R a a_1 => a_1 = [] ∨ ∃ b l, R a b ∧ List.Chain R b l ∧ a_1 = b :: l
```

and is useful to rewrite in a theorem that argues about the properties of an unapplied inductive predicate.

---

nodes.body:
I wrote this for my (not-yet-approved, thus stalled) refactor of bundled sets.
More code can be found in #6442

```lean
structure BundledSet (α : Type*) (p : Set α → Prop) where
  carrier : Set α
  prop : p carrier

namespace BundledSet

class InterPred (α : Type*) (p : Set α → Prop) : Prop where
  inter' : ∀ s t, p s → p t → p (s ∩ t)

instance {α} {p q : Set α → Prop} [InterPred α p] [InterPred α q] :
    InterPred α fun s ↦ p s ∧ q s :=
  sorry

end BundledSet

open BundledSet

structure IsSubmagma {M : Type*} [Mul M] (s : Set M) : Prop where
  mul_mem x y : x ∈ s → y ∈ s → x * y ∈ s

instance {M : Type*} [Mul M] : InterPred M IsSubmagma := sorry

structure IsOneMem {M : Type*} [One M] (s : Set M) : Prop where
  one_mem : 1 ∈ s

instance {M : Type*} [One M] : InterPred M IsOneMem := sorry

@[mk_eq]
structure IsSubmonoid {M : Type*} [MulOneClass M] (s : Set M) : Prop
  extends IsSubmagma s, IsOneMem s

instance {M : Type*} [MulOneClass M] : InterPred M IsSubmonoid := by
  simp only [isSubmonoid_eq]; infer_instance
```

### PR summary [3cb9ca52ac](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9654/commits/3cb9ca52ac6fd1b96d96ed38885843d653521d59)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ funext1`
`+ funextArray`
`+ funextN`
`+ mkEqIffOfInductivePropImpl`
`- mkIffOfInductivePropImpl`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Overall I'm happy with the implementation but I must say that I don't understand the intended use. Could you give an example of a proof where `mk_eq` is more useful than `mk_iff`? I also don't like the name, but having a clearer picture of the use could convince me that the name is fine.

Overall I'm happy with the implementation but I must say that I don't understand the intended use. Could you give an example of a proof where `mk_eq` is more useful than `mk_iff`? I also don't like the name, but having a clearer picture of the use could convince me that the name is fine.

I'm surprised this didn't exist already, but indeed the closest I could find is [`Lean.Elab.Eqns.funext?`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Lean/Elab/PreDefinition/Eqns.html#Lean.Elab.Eqns.funext?) which doesn't allow you to supply variable names. I suppose you could use `Eqns.funext?` in this implementation but honestly it seems like your `funext1` is more useful in general.
Note to self: shouldn't we use the existing variable names when doing `funext` here? Not really, the funext is just an internal proof implementation.

pullRequest.title: feat: add `@[mk_eq]` version of `@[mk_iff]`

nodes.body: Overall I'm happy with the implementation but I must say that I don't understand the intended use. Could you give an example of a proof where `mk_eq` is more useful than `mk_iff`? I also don't like the name, but having a clearer picture of the use could convince me that the name is fine.

I wrote this for my (not-yet-approved, thus stalled) refactor of bundled sets.
More code can be found in #6442

```lean
structure BundledSet (α : Type*) (p : Set α → Prop) where
  carrier : Set α
  prop : p carrier

namespace BundledSet

class InterPred (α : Type*) (p : Set α → Prop) : Prop where
  inter' : ∀ s t, p s → p t → p (s ∩ t)

instance {α} {p q : Set α → Prop} [InterPred α p] [InterPred α q] :
    InterPred α fun s ↦ p s ∧ q s :=
  sorry

end BundledSet

open BundledSet

structure IsSubmagma {M : Type*} [Mul M] (s : Set M) : Prop where
  mul_mem x y : x ∈ s → y ∈ s → x * y ∈ s

instance {M : Type*} [Mul M] : InterPred M IsSubmagma := sorry

structure IsOneMem {M : Type*} [One M] (s : Set M) : Prop where
  one_mem : 1 ∈ s

instance {M : Type*} [One M] : InterPred M IsOneMem := sorry

@[mk_eq]
structure IsSubmonoid {M : Type*} [MulOneClass M] (s : Set M) : Prop
  extends IsSubmagma s, IsOneMem s

instance {M : Type*} [MulOneClass M] : InterPred M IsSubmonoid := by
  simp only [isSubmonoid_eq]; infer_instance
```
